alert.note: Alert for Monongalia (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 5:52PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Monongalia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 551 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in portions of Monongalia County. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morgantown, Westover, Star City, Granville, Cassville, Brookhaven, Blacksville, Core, Georgetown, Osage, Crown, Booth, Everettville, Pentress, McCurdyville, Daybrook, Cheat Lake, Wana and Wadestown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
